lead_paragraph: Citing the risks of second-hand smoke to nonsmokers, Gov. Pete Wilson today signed an executive order banning smoking in all buildings owned or leased by state agencies under his direct control. The ban will affect 300,000 people. The order, which takes effect next Monday, covers 19,518 buildings owned by the state and 2,067 leased buildings that are occupied by 180,000 employees, 110,000 prison inmates and 4,500 patients of state hospitals. In prisons, smoking will be allowed solely in outdoor recreation yards.
